result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S. Trevino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Firearms warning given based on DV enhancer

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay fine of $250    and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
May not have contact with any victims in both cases, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  No sentence credit.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVOKED  -  COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  CONCURRENT TO 15CF138.  Court obligations were paid in full

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S. Trevino

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoked-Sentenced to County Jail/HOC on 8-31-16
Plea/Sentence Hearing-January 6, 2016

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1030 - Sentence recommendations made.  Defendant is sentenced to 6 months in the Kenosha County Jail concurrent to 15CF138.  Credit for 153 days. Any costs still outstanding on this case are to be converted to civil judgment. No new costs entered.
Due to ongoing judicial education, SEHR rescheduled by court to 8/31/16 @ 10:30am. Attys to confirm by email.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1003 - Atty Allen requests adjournment to allow for resolution of all cases - granted.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
At the request of Atty Allen - SEHR rescheduled to 7/20/16 @ 10am. Attys confirm by email.
At the request of Atty Allen - SEHR rescheduled to 6/23/16 @ 9am to allow settlement of new charges. Attys confirm by email.
Notice of Hearing for DE returned.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.

from DOC agent Ken Loberg re: deft's probation order on 1/6/16 has been ordered revoked as of 4/13/16 due to violations, see attached Violation Report/Revocation Summary. It is recommended that the Court sentence the deft to 6-9 months in KCJ on each case.
Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 4/13/16; to be returned to court for sentencing.  Zero balance due.  kmk
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing scheduled 5/11 @ 9:30am.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1143 - Matter heard with 15CF138. Court reviews deportation notice with DE. No actions to be taken or changed by Atty Allen or DE.
Bond applied; partial refund; ds/jg   /   ck#16CH075621
Hearing at 02-17-2016 10:30 am
Hearing scheduled re: deportation notice per judge.
Wheaton Franciscan Healthcare/Interdisciplinary Discharge Plans and Instructions: Mental Health and Addiction Care
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1119 - Matter heard with 15CF138. Parties report this case is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty as to Ct1 - found guilty by the court. Sentence recommendations made.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions.  $250 fine plus court costs ordered.  No restitution requested. DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay $200 DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal rights given.  Firearms Warning given based on DV enhancer.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. No appearance by Atty Allen or DE.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 928 - Matter heard with 15CF138. Atty Allen appeared; date was given off the record. Plea hearing scheduled 1/6/16 @ 10am.
Final pre-trial at 11-23-2015 09:00 am

Attorney Allen is requesting 9/2/2015 Final pre-trial be rescheduled - DE is currently in custody on an unrelated commitment until approx. 9/20/2015 & will commence treatment upon release.  State does not object.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 11/23/2015 at 9am.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney James Allen.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:53pm-  Matter heard with 15CF138.  Attorney Allen is requesting an adjournment - DE is currently on a waiting list for in patient treatment.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to September 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney James Allen.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:20am-  Matter heard with 15CF138.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Allen is requesting an adjournment.  Matter is tenatively resolved but DE needs to enroll in inpatient treatment prior to the matter being resolved.  Discussion held.  Final pre-trial adjourned to June 25, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on April 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. White & State v. White), 3/18/2015 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 4/30/2015 at 9am.  NTBS by the Court.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

115pm
  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk LE.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  PTC on 2/27/15 @ 115pm.  FPT on 3/18/15 @ 230pm.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/Rachel H, Cynthia V, Rhonda M and Berenice C or their residences
